Client

Client.php : 57

The main class that allows you to use payment gateway's functions.

Tags
example

<code>

use OndraKoupil\Csob;

$config = new Config( "Your Merchant ID", "Path to your private key file", "Path to bank's public key file", "Your e-shop name", "Some URL to return customers to", GatewayUrl::TEST_LATEST );

$client = new Client($config);

// Check if connection and signing works $client->testGetConnection(); $client->testPostConnection();

// Create new payment with some item in cart $payment = new Payment("12345"); $payment->addCartItem("Some cool stuff", 1, 10000);

$client->paymentInit($payment);

// Check for payment status $client->paymentStatus($payment);

// Get URL to send the customer to $url = $client->getPaymentProcessUrl($payment);

// Or redirect him there right now $client->redirectToGateway($payment);

// Cancel the payment $client->paymentReverse($payment);

// Or approve the payment (if not set to do that automatically) $client->paymentClose($payment);

</code>

buttonInit()

Client.php : 1098

Performs a button/init API call in API >= 1.8

public buttonInit(Payment $payment, string $clientIp[, string $brand = 'csob' ][, \OndraKoupil\Csob\Extension[]|Extension $extensions = array() ]) : array

You need a Payment object, but DO NOT process it via paymentInit() method. You don't need its PayID. It is used only as source of data for calling API.

Items in cart in Payment object are not used, only total sum of their prices.

In response, you'll receive an array with [redirect], which should be another array with [method], [url] and possibly [params] items. Redirect your user to that address to complete the payment. Do not use redirectToGateway(), just redirect to $response[redirect][url].

Parameters
$payment : Payment
$clientIp : string
$brand : string = 'csob'

"csob" or "era"

$extensions : \OndraKoupil\Csob\Extension[]|Extension = array()
Tags
see
https://github.com/csob/paymentgateway/wiki/Metody-pro-platebn%C3%AD-tla%C4%8D%C3%ADtko

for details

Return values
array —

customerInfo()

Client.php : 1297

Performs customer/info (below v1.8) or echo/customer (>=v1.8) API call.

public customerInfo(string|array|Payment $customerId[, bool $returnIfHasCardsOnly = true ]) : bool|int

Use this method to check if customer with given ID has any saved cards. If he does, you can show some icon or change default payment method in e-shop or do some other action. This is just an auxiliary method and is not neccessary at all.

Parameters
$customerId : string|array|Payment

Customer ID, Payment object or array as returned from paymentInit

$returnIfHasCardsOnly : bool = true
Return values
bool|int —

If $returnIfHasCardsOnly is set to true, method returns boolean indicating whether given customerID has any saved cards. If it is set to false, then method returns one of CUSTOMER_*** constants which can be used to distinguish more precisely whether customer just hasn't saved any cards or was not found at all.

customRequest()

Client.php : 1192

Sends an arbitrary request to bank's API with any parameters.

public customRequest(string $methodUrl, array $inputPayload[, array $expectedOutputFields = array() ][, \OndraKoupil\Csob\Extension[]|Extension $extensions = array() ][, string $method = "POST" ][, bool $logOutput = false ][, bool $ignoreInvalidReturnSignature = false ]) : array|string

Use this method to call various masterpass/* API methods or any methods of API versions that may come in future and are not implemented in this library yet.

$inputPayload is an associative array with data in order in which they should be signed. You can leave dttm and merchantId empty or null, their values will be filled automatically, however you can't omit them completely, since they are required in the signature. Signature field will be added automatically.

$expectedOutputFields should be ordinary array of field names in order they appear in the response. Their order in the array is important to verify response signature. You can leave this empty, the base string will be created on order as the keys appear in the response. However, it can't be guaranteed it is the correct order. If you want it to be more reliable, I recommend to define it.

Example - testing post connection:

$client->customRequest(
  'echo',
  array(
    'merchantId' => null,
    'dttm' => null
  )
);
Parameters
$methodUrl : string

API method name, without leading slash, ie. "payment/init"

$inputPayload : array

Input payload in form of associative array. Order of items is significant.

$expectedOutputFields : array = array()

Expected field names of response in order in which they should be returned.

$extensions : \OndraKoupil\Csob\Extension[]|Extension = array()
$method : string = "POST"

HTTP method

$logOutput : bool = false

Should be the complete output logged into debug log?

$ignoreInvalidReturnSignature : bool = false

If set to true, then in case of invalid signature of returned data, no exception will be thrown and method will return received data as usual. Then, you should handle the situation by yourself. Do not use this option on regular basis, it is intended only as workaround for cases when returned data or its signature is more complex and its verification fails for some reason.

Return values
array|string —

getPaymentCheckoutUrl()

Client.php : 270

Generates checkout URL to send customer's browser to after initiating the payment.

public getPaymentCheckoutUrl(string|Payment $payment, int $oneClickPaymentCheckbox[, bool|null $displayOmnibox = null ][, string|null $returnCheckoutUrl = null ]) : string
Parameters
$payment : string|Payment

Either PayID given during paymentInit(), or just the Payment object you used in paymentInit()

$oneClickPaymentCheckbox : int

Flag to indicate whether to display the checkbox for saving card for future payments and to indicate whether it should be preselected or not. 0 - hidden, unchecked 1 - displayed, unchecked 2 - displayed, checked 3 - hidden, checked (you need to indicate to customer that this happens before initiating the payment)

$displayOmnibox : bool|null = null

Flag to indicate whether to display omnibox in desktop's iframe version instead of card number, expiration and cvc fields

$returnCheckoutUrl : string|null = null

URL for scenario when process needs to get back to checkout page

Return values
string —

paymentButton()

Client.php : 1028

Performs a payment/button API call in API <= 1.7

public paymentButton(Payment $payment[, string $brand = "csob" ][, \OndraKoupil\Csob\Extension[]|Extension $extensions = array() ]) : array|string

You need a Payment object that was already processed via paymentInit() method (or was injected with a payId that you received from other source).

In response, you'll receive an array with [redirect], which should be another array with [method] and [url] items. Redirect your user to that address to complete the payment. Do not use redirectToGateway(), just redirect to $response[redirect][url].

Parameters
$payment : Payment
$brand : string = "csob"

"csob" or "era"

$extensions : \OndraKoupil\Csob\Extension[]|Extension = array()
Tags
deprecated

Not available since API 1.8, use buttonInit() instead

Return values
array|string —

paymentClose()

Client.php : 525

Performs payment/close API call.

public paymentClose(string|Payment $payment[, bool $ignoreWrongPaymentStatusError = false ][, int $amount = null ][, \OndraKoupil\Csob\Extension[]|Extension $extensions = array() ]) : array|null

If you want to accept (close) payments manually, set property $closePayment of Payment object or Config object to false. Then, payments will wait in state 4 for your approval by calling paymentClose().

Normally, payment must be in state 4 to be eligible for this operation. If the payment is not in an acceptable state, then the gateway returns an error code 150 and exception is thrown from here. Set $ignoreWrongPaymentStatusError to true if you are okay with that situation and you want to silently ignore it. Method then returns null.

If some other type of error occurs, exception will be thrown in all cases.

Parameters
$payment : string|Payment

Either PayID given during paymentInit(), or just the Payment object you used in paymentInit()

$ignoreWrongPaymentStatusError : bool = false
$amount : int = null

Amount of finance to close (if different from originally authorized amount). Use hundreths of basic currency unit.

$extensions : \OndraKoupil\Csob\Extension[]|Extension = array()
Tags
throws
Exception
Return values
array|null —

Array with results of call or null if payment is not in correct state

paymentInit()

Client.php : 166

Performs payment/init API call.

public paymentInit(Payment $payment[, \OndraKoupil\Csob\Extension[]|Extension $extensions = array() ]) : array

Use this to create new payment in payment gateway. After successful call, the $payment object will be updated by given PayID.

Parameters
$payment : Payment

Create and fill this object manually with real data.

$extensions : \OndraKoupil\Csob\Extension[]|Extension = array()

Added extensions

Return values
array —

Array with results of the call. You don't need to use any of this, PayID will be set to $payment automatically.

paymentOneClickEcho()

Client.php : 963

Performs a oneclick/echo API call.

public paymentOneClickEcho(string $origPayId) : number

Use this method to check whether a oneclick template is still ready to be used.

CAUTION! The method returns a numeric code. 0 means success. Positive number means failure. Do not just if ($client->paymentOneClickEcho($payId)) { success(); } else { fail(); }!!

See https://github.com/csob/paymentgateway/wiki/Vol%C3%A1n%C3%AD-rozhran%C3%AD-eAPI#operation-return-code for explanation.

Parameters
$origPayId : string

The PayID of original payment template.

Tags
see
https://github.com/csob/paymentgateway/wiki/Vol%C3%A1n%C3%AD-rozhran%C3%AD-eAPI#operation-return-code
Return values
number —

0 = template is OK, number 700-740 = template is not OK.

paymentOneClickInit()

Client.php : 810

Performs a payment/oneclick/init API call.

public paymentOneClickInit(Payment|string $origPayment, Payment $newPayment[, \OndraKoupil\Csob\Extension[]|Extension $extensions = array() ][, string $clientIp = '' ]) : array

Use this method to redo a payment that has already been marked as a template for recurring payments and approved by customer

  • see Payment::setOneClickPayment()

You need PayID of the original payment and a new Payment object. Only $orderNo, $totalAmount (sum of cart items added by addToCart), $currency and $description of $newPayment are used, others are ignored.

Note that if $totalAmount is set, then also $currency must be set. If not, CZK is used as default value.

$orderNo is the only mandatory value in $newPayment. Other properties can be left null to use original values from $origPayment.

After successful call, received PayID will be set in $newPayment object. Then, pass this object to paymentOneClickStart method.

This method is a successor of now deprecated paymentRecurrent() method.

Since API v 1.8, this method uses oneclick/init endpoint.

Parameters
$origPayment : Payment|string

Either string PayID or a Payment object

$newPayment : Payment
$extensions : \OndraKoupil\Csob\Extension[]|Extension = array()
$clientIp : string = ''

IP address of customer's browser

Tags
see
Payment::setOneClickPayment()
see
paymentOneClickStart()
Return values
array —

Data with new values

Use this method to confirm a recurring one click payment that was previously initiated using paymentOneClickInit() method.

paymentRecurrent()

Client.php : 714

Performs payment/recurrent API call.

public paymentRecurrent(Payment|string $origPayment, Payment $newPayment) : array

Use this method to redo a payment that has already been marked as a template for recurring payments and approved by customer

  • see Payment::setRecurrentPayment()

You need PayID of the original payment and a new Payment object. Only $orderNo, $totalAmount (sum of cart items added by addToCart), $currency and $description of $newPayment are used, others are ignored.

Note that if $totalAmount is set, then also $currency must be set. If not, CZK is used as default value.

$orderNo is the only mandatory value in $newPayment. Other properties can be left null to use original values from $origPayment.

After successful call, received PayID will be set in $newPayment object.

Parameters
$origPayment : Payment|string

Either string PayID or a Payment object

$newPayment : Payment
Tags
throws
Exception
deprecated

Deprecated since eAPI 1.7, please use paymentOneClick() instead.

see
Payment::setRecurrentPayment()
see
paymentOneClickInit()
Return values
array —

Data with new values

paymentRefund()

Client.php : 615

Performs payment/refund API call.

public paymentRefund(string|Payment $payment[, bool $ignoreWrongPaymentStatusError = false ][, int $amount = null ][, \OndraKoupil\Csob\Extension[]|Extension $extensions = array() ]) : array|null

If you want to send money back to your customer after payment has been completely processed and money transferred, use this method.

Normally, payment must be in state 8 to be eligible for this operation. If the payment is not in an acceptable state, then the gateway returns an error code 150 and exception is thrown from here. Set $ignoreWrongPaymentStatusError to true if you are okay with that situation and you want to silently ignore it. Method then returns null.

If some other type of error occurs, exception will be thrown in all cases.

Note: on testing environment, refunding often ends up with HTTP code 500 and exception thrown. This is a bug in payment gateway - see https://github.com/csob/paymentgateway/issues/43, however it is still not resolved. On production environment, this should be OK.

Parameters
$payment : string|Payment

Either PayID given during paymentInit(), or just the Payment object you used in paymentInit()

$ignoreWrongPaymentStatusError : bool = false
$amount : int = null

Optionally, an amount (<b>in hundreths of basic money unit</b> - beware!) can be passed, so that the payment will be refunded partially. Null means full refund.

$extensions : \OndraKoupil\Csob\Extension[]|Extension = array()
Return values
array|null —

Array with results of call or null if payment is not in correct state

paymentReverse()

Client.php : 441

Performs payment/reverse API call.

public paymentReverse(string|array|Payment $payment[, bool $ignoreWrongPaymentStatusError = false ][, \OndraKoupil\Csob\Extension[]|Extension $extensions = array() ]) : array|null

Reversing payment means stopping payment that has not yet been processed by bank (usually about 1 working day after being created).

Normally, payment must be in state 4 or 7 to be reversable. If the payment is not in an acceptable state, then the gateway returns an error code 150 and exception is thrown from here. Set $ignoreWrongPaymentStatusError to true if you are okay with that situation and you want to silently ignore it. Method then returns null.

If some other type of error occurs, exception will be thrown anyway.

Parameters
$payment : string|array|Payment

Either PayID given during paymentInit(), or whole returned array from paymentInit or just the Payment object you used in paymentInit()

$ignoreWrongPaymentStatusError : bool = false
$extensions : \OndraKoupil\Csob\Extension[]|Extension = array()
Tags
throws
Exception
Return values
array|null —

Array with results of call or null if payment is not in correct state

paymentStatus()

Client.php : 365

Check payment status by calling payment/status API method.

public paymentStatus(string|Payment $payment[, bool $returnStatusOnly = true ][, \OndraKoupil\Csob\Extension[]|Extension $extensions = array() ][, mixed $nullIfPaymentNotFound = true ]) : array|number

Use this to check current status of some transaction. See ČSOB's wiki on Github for explanation of each status.

Basically, they are:

  • 1 = new; after paymentInit() but before customer starts filling in his card number and authorising the transaction
  • 2 = in progress; during customer's stay at payment gateway
  • 4 = after successful authorisation but before it is approved by you by calling paymentClose. This state is skipped if you use Payment->closePayment = true or Config->closePayment = true.
  • 7 = waiting for being processed by bank. The payment will remain in this state for about one working day. You can call paymentReverse() during this time to stop it from being processed.
  • 5 = cancelled by you. Payment gets here after calling paymentReverse().
  • 8 = finished. This means money is already probably on your account. If you want to cancel the payment, you can only refund it by calling paymentRefund().
  • 9 = being refunded
  • 10 = refunded
  • 6 or 3 = payment was not authorised or was cancelled by customer
Parameters
$payment : string|Payment

Either PayID given during paymentInit(), or just the Payment object you used in paymentInit()

$returnStatusOnly : bool = true

Leave on true if you want to return only status code. Set to false if you want more information as array.

$extensions : \OndraKoupil\Csob\Extension[]|Extension = array()
$nullIfPaymentNotFound : mixed = true
Return values
array|number —

Number if $returnStatusOnly was true, array otherwise.

receiveReturningCustomer()

Client.php : 1378

Processes the data that are sent together with customer when he returns back from payment gateway.

public receiveReturningCustomer([array|null $input = null ]) : array|null

Call this method on your returnUrl to extract all data from request, validate signature, decode merchant data from base64 and return it all as an array. Method automatically reads data from GET or POST.

Parameters
$input : array|null = null

If return data is not in GET or POST, supply your own array with accordingly named variables.

Return values
array|null —

Array with received data or null if no data is present.
